Title: Data Analyst - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: São Mamede de Infesta, Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Como imaginas o futuro?

O nosso propósito é criar um futuro mais inteligente para uma vida melhor.

Contamos contigo para te juntares a nós e ajudares a construir um mundo melhor para as gerações futuras.

Quem somos:

A Efacec é uma empresa com 75 anos de história a inovar pelo mundo que partilhamos, atuando em setores estruturantes para a sociedade e de reconhecida importância em todas as geografias em que está presente, promovendo a mudança e impactando positivamente milhões de pessoas.

  • Interagir com os utilizadores, recolher requisitos, desenvolver especificações, desenvolver e testar programas;

  • Formação em Ciências da Computação ou experiência de trabalho equivalente;

  • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento em SQL com SSIS, SSRS e SSAS;
  • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento com PowerBI;
  • Conhecimento intermediário de MS Excel, SharePoint e PowerPlatform (PowerApps, Automate) é uma vantagem;
  • Domínio da língua Inglesa (falada e escrita);
  • Dinamismo e proatividade;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade e compromisso;
  • Capacidade de organização e planeamento;
  • Espírito de equipa;
  • Orientação para a mudança e inovação.


O que oferecemos:

  • Possibilidade de integrar um grupo empresarial de referência com forte presença internacional;
  • Possibilidade de aprendizagem e capacitação num regime de “learning by doing”;
  • Acesso a formação através da nossa Mast3r Academia (Academia de formação interna) e de instituições de ensino;
  • Acesso permanente aos nossos serviços médicos e de enfermagem;
  • Acesso a protocolos e parcerias estratégicas;
  • Possibilidade de trabalhar num regime híbrido (presencial/remoto).

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
As one of the world's leading logistics companies, we have opened a new IT Centre in Porto, Portugal. Our aim is to accelerate digital technologies for our global customers, focusing on the development of new mission-critical products, e-solutions and new digital services. Join our fascinating and international working environment and become part of the team responsible for developing our digital logistics processes in line with the Kuehne+Nagel strategy.

Your Role

As a Data Analyst, you will support the logistics team by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to drive decision-making and optimize logistics operations. Your role involves working with large datasets to identify trends, generate insights, and provide actionable recommendations to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance overall supply chain performance.

Your Responsibilities


Data Collection & Management:
Gather, clean, and maintain large datasets related to logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, inventory, and supply chain performance.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular audits and data validation checks.
Data Analysis:
Analyze logistics data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders.
Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Performance Monitoring:
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to logistics activities, such as delivery times, transportation costs, inventory levels, and order accuracy.
Identify areas of inefficiency and recommend process improvements to optimize logistics operations.
Reporting:
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports for management, highlighting key findings, trends, and areas for improvement.
Communicate complex data clearly and concisely to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including supply chain, operations, and IT, to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Collaborate with IT to improve data collection methods and tools and to implement new analytics solutions.
Process Improvement:
Identify and recommend new technologies or tools to enhance data analysis capabilities and streamline logistics processes.
Support the implementation of new systems and tools by providing data-driven insights and conducting training sessions for staff.
Compliance & Risk Management:
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company data handling and reporting policies.
Identify potential risks in logistics operations based on data analysis and suggest mitigation strategies.


Your Skills And Experiences


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in data analysis, preferably within a logistics, supply chain, or transportation environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Excel, Python, R, or other statistical software.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of logistics and supply chain concepts and best practices is highly desirable.


Preferred Skills:


Experience with ERP systems, transportation management systems (TMS), or warehouse management systems (WMS).
Familiarity with machine learning or predictive analytics in a logistics context.
Advanced Excel skills (macros, pivot tables, complex formulas).

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Data Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling skillls are mandatory (Dataiku and/or Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode – a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level

Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.

A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.

Se és um profissional apaixonado pelo universo automóvel e pela inovação na mobilidade, e queres enfrentar novos desafios, estás no sitio certo. Procuramos pessoas que queiram fazer parte de um projeto líder no setor, contribuindo para a transformação e excelência num ambiente dinâmico e desafiante.

Procuramos um(a) Data Engineer para um projeto híbrido ou remoto no Porto.

Como é Ser Data Engineer?

  • A integrar na equipa de Analytics, procuramos Data Engineer com capacidade de reunir grandes e complexos conjuntos de dados que atendam aos requisitos de negócios funcionais/não funcionais;
  • Desenho e Implementação de projetos de Analytics;
  • Identificar, definir e implementar melhorias de processos internos: automatizar processos manuais, otimizar a entrega de dados, redesenhar a infraestrutura para maior escalabilidade, etc.

O Que Valorizamos

  • Licenciado(a) em Engenharia Informática, Sistemas Informação ou similar;
  • Experiência na área de Analytics;
  • Experiência em DataWarehouse | SQL Server;
  • Preferencialmente experiência em Power BI;
  • Elevado sentido de responsabilidade, espírito de equipa, autonomia, proatividade e capacidade de adaptação;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Inglês e, preferencialmente, espanhol e francês;
  • Facilidade de comunicação e de relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Capacidade de autonomia e organização;
  • Capacidade de análise;
  • Pro-atividade e dinamismo.

O que oferecemos?

  • Seguro de Saúde;
  • Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;
  • Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;
  • Processo de onboarding remoto;
  • Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;
  • Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;
  • Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!

Candidaturas

Title: Data Visualization Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:


Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.



What are we looking for?


BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
Proficiency in Power BI;
Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data Engineer




YOUR MISSIONS:




Design and implement ETL pipelines in Python, integrating data from multiple sources (APIs, databases, flat files) and ensuring performance and security.
Define and implement REST APIs for data manipulation, utilizing big data tools like Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, and HBase for processing.
Optimize data processing, manage deployments using CI/CD tools, and troubleshoot issues to ensure data quality and system reliability.
Participate in SCRUM meetings, collaborating with team members across locations while contributing to technical design, documentation, and testing.
Integrate additional technologies and cloud storage solutions into the overall data ecosystem.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Experience with Big Data technologies including Hadoop, Spark, Hive, and Kerberos
Proficiency in Python 3, its libraries, frameworks, and tools
Integration and interaction with RESTful APIs
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong background in relational databases such as Oracle, MySQL, and MariaDB
Familiarity with NoSQL databases, particularly HBase
Proficiency in English.
Hybrid regime in the Porto office.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: VIE Data Analyst/Scientist, Lisbonne H/F
Description:
VIE Data Analyst/Scientist, PF - Lisbonne, H/F

Concrètement votre quotidien ?

En tant que Data Analyst/Scientist, vous utiliserez Python pour collecter, préparer et analyser les données, afin de répondre aux besoins analytiques des différents pays. Vous pourrez aussi être amené à utiliser des méthodes statistiques pour analyser la significativité des résultats. Enfin, vous pourrez être amené à utiliser nos produits internes pour utiliser des modèles de machine learning.

Pour Un Projet Type


Vous serez en contact avec le pays pour récupérer les données et comprendre les besoins
Vous préparerez les données puis effectuerez les analyses
Vous utiliserez un modèle de Machine Learning si nécessaire
Vous présenterez les résultats aux interlocuteurs pays


Vous intéragirez avec les Data Scientists et les Devs de l'équipe pour utiliser les produits de l'équipe utilisant de l'IA pour optimiser les interactions avec nos clients.

L'environnement de travail, c'est important !

Bienvenue au sein du Hub Analytics Marketing. Une équipe de 35 personnes, composée en 4 équipes de 8 (+ Managers). Cette équipe fait partie de BNP Personal Finance, et supporte le central pour développer l'analytique dans tous nos pays. Nous mettons en avant un effort particulier pour utiliser l'IA afin d'améliorer les interactions avec nos clients.

Le Hub Marketing est organisé en mode Agile, pour le moment proche de Scrum mais en évolution en fonction des retours de l'équipe.

L'équipe est récente (créée il y a 3 ans), jeune (grand nombre de personnes <30 ans), mais contient aussi des séniors permettant à tous de progresser. Majoritairement située à Lisbonne, à côté du centre commercial Colombo, une partie de l'équipe est également à Porto (Urbo).

Le télétravail est disponible à un rythme de 3 jours par semaines maximum.

Et après ?

Le Hub Marketing contient 3 profils différents : Data Analyst, Data Scientist et Developeurs Python. En rajoutant le mix junior/senior, c'est un environnement idéal pour se développer. La proximité au business permet aussi de se développer en présentations et project management. Enfin l'organisation Agile permet d'acquérir des compétences de plus en plus demandées sur le marché.

L'équipe fait partie d'une plus grande équipe avec d'autres expertises en risque et en MLOps/MLEngineering, permettant des collaborations, acroissant encore plus les possibilités de réseau et de développement.

Du fait de sa position d'équipe centrale, cette équipe vous permettra d'établir un bon réseau au sein de l'entité : les business des autres pays, l'équipe centrale en France, et même les autres entités du groupe BNP par moment.

Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?

Notre monde change ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.

Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur : https://group.bnpparibas/emploi-carriere/bnp-paribas

Et la rémunération ?

Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.

Etes-vous notre prochain VIE Data Analyst/Scientist, PF basé à Lisbonne, H/F ?

A vous de nous convaincre !

Oui, si vous êtes titulaire d’un Master 2 ou diplôme d’ingénieur en Data analyse ou en mathématiques.

Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 6 mois minimum sur un poste similaire au sein d’une banque ou une institution financière.

Vous parlez couramment anglais et vous disposez de solides connaissances en analyse de données, en marketing digital et en marketing.Vous maîtrisez également le Pack Office et le langage PYTHON.

Votre adaptabilité et votre capacité à collaborer sont des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela votre capacité à communiquer, votre rigueur ainsi que votre proactivité pour finir de nous convaincre.

Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.

Durée et disponibilité

Ce VIE est à pourvoir dès que possible pour une durée de 12 mois.

Les conditions d’éligibilité au contrat VIE (selon les règles fixées par Business France) sont consultables sur : https://www.civiweb.com/

Pensez à ajouter votre CV et votre lettre de motivation en anglais sur votre espace candidat.

Si votre CV est retenu par notre équipe de recrutement, vous serez amené à passer un à trois entretiens au maximum avec des RH (Staffing Business Partner) et/ou manager opérationnel.

La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes : tous les postes au sein du Groupe sont ouverts à tous !

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity

Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Analytics e procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades:

  • Planear e executar com autonomia as atividades a realizar na elaboração dos diversos outputs no âmbito de um projeto;
  • Gerir responsavelmente e de acordo com a sua esfera de atuação as relações diárias com o cliente.


És tu quem procuramos?

Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long-term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills in Python and knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy, scikit-learn, pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

Title: Lead Data Analyst (Cloud Technologies)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
At Sogrape, we are embarking on a transformative data journey, and we are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. Be part of our data transformation journey as the Cloud Data Platform Lead Analyst. You will oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform analytic solutions, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and execute reporting for the organisation.




In this role, as Lead data analyst, you will engage with business stakeholders to discuss their requirements, implement challenging analytic solutions, and ensure comprehensive reporting across the organization. You will be responsible for upholding data governance and quality, shaping our organization's data infrastructure to drive valuable insights.




If you are skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project. Apply now and become a catalyst in our organization's data transformation journey.




Your main responsibilities:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions
You will be responsible for developing comprehensive analytic solutions tailored to business requirements and ensuring that organizational reporting meets the highest standards of accuracy and relevance
Ensure data quality and governance by implementing and maintaining data standards, policies, and procedures
Collect, clean and analyze data from various sources, including Google Cloud Platform or others, to provide actionable insights
Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Power BI to support business decision-making
Provide training and support to business users, empowering them to effectively interact with data visualizations and accurately interpret results
Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data reporting practices, continuously improving our business intelligence platform




What we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum of 2 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a focus on building reporting and analysis for business
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as Azure (Data Factory, Power BI, SQL) and Google Cloud (BigQuery)
Possess strong analytical skills and a solid understanding of data modelling, particularly within cloud data architectures. Ensure adherence to data quality and governance principles for implementing analytic solutions tailored to business needs
Proficient in structured query languages (SQL) and programming languages such as Python, PySpark
Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work closely with business stakeholders to translate their requirements into data and reporting needs
Experience in providing training and support to business users on data visualizations and interpretation
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment




What we have to offer:

Work with a specialized team in a global family wine company with a strong international presence in more than 120 markets
Hybrid working model and additional vacation days
Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands
Exclusive access to wine tourism experiences at our properties
Specialized wine training at the Sogrape Wine Academy
Health Insurance, Sogrape Pension Plan, Flexible Benefits Plan, and wellness initiatives
Professional development opportunities




Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Fraud Prevention
HTML:
Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 1,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.


Your Mission


You will be a part of a joint team of machine learning engineers and data scientists building and evolving ML models, real time systems, reports, and deep analysis of fraud detection and mitigation activities to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from fraudulent activities.

Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants. Key individual contributor for a diverse and innovative team to create deep understanding of big data inputs and contribute to continuous improvement while addressing fast-moving risks and opportunities.


Working with senior product, business, and engineering leaders to analyze data, identify opportunities for building new models, build and maintain real time dashboards, and deliver insights through in-depth reports. Collaborate with your peers across Teya to share insights and enable real-time decision making wherever opportunity arises.


As a Senior Data Analyst on the Fraud Prevention team you will:


  • Lead with data to design, develop, and implement solutions for Fraud Prevention;
  • Collect, store, and analyse large data sets;
  • Integrate data into business processes and systems;
  • Write complex SQL queries and scripts;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, product managers, and business analysts;
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports in a variety of environments including Snowflake and Tableau;
  • Effectively manage business stakeholders and drive initiatives to promote actionable insights, identifying and prioritising requirements and owning a roadmap of deliverables;
  • Analyse external customer and internal business data working with teams across different countries to drive optimisation of our products;
  • Build predictive models to accurately forecast our numbers and evaluate against the budget and actuals.
  • Promote a data-driven culture across the business


Your Story


Basic Requirements


  • 5+ years of professional data analyst experience in a technical domain
  • Highly proficient in SQL and Tableau (or equivalent BI tool)
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing circumstances quickly
  • Capable of translating complex data into understandable conclusions and recommendations
  • Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems
  • Good written and verbal communication skills


Preferred Requirements


  • Experience with Machine Learning and Python (time-series analysis, forecasting)
  • Familiarity with AWS environment (SageMaker, S3, Redshift)
  • Familiarity with Snowflake
  • Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, or relevant experience in related field


The Perks


  • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Meal Allowance;
  • 25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
  • Public Transportation Card;
  • Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
  • Office snacks every day;
  • Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.

Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.

Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.
Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent interpersonal & communication skills with the ability to interact effectively throughout various functional groups and hierarchical levels


Excellent knowledge of English is a must (working language)

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Engineer - GCP for a project based in Porto (Hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery;
  • Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes;
  • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting;
  • Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing;
  • Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field;
  • 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required;
  • Proficiency with SQL and experience in writing complex queries;
  • Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools;
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques;
  • Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing;
  • Experience in backend development with Java;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/DataEngineer_GCP”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma equipa onde trabalharás com os melhores especialistas em Data. Enquanto Engineer, terás a oportunidade de levar os nossos projetos de transformação ao próximo nível, à escala global, criando e entregando soluções inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills de abstração e alguns conhecimentos técnicos da plataforma, com o mindset orientado para a excelência do nosso serviço ao cliente.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com formação ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Terás uma experiência profissional que te irá inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação.

Estão reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que é o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em várias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementação, e monitorização de pipelines ETL;
  • Criação de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementação de soluções data-driven distribuídas com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders na definição, tratamento de dados e implementação de modelos avançados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordenação entre equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;


És tu quem procuramos:

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experiência profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Excelentes capacidades de comunicação oral e escrita, em português e inglês, para públicos técnicos e de negócio;
  • Residir em Portugal (obrigatório);
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, trabalho em equipa, resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long-term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills in Python and knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy, scikit-learn, pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the Facility Management Industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto tech hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Are you ready to transform the Integrated Facility Management Industry?

To become the technology leader in the Integrated Facility Management industry (FMS), we're developing digital components connected by AWS and Azure cloud solutions, we build up our machine learning models to make yet better use of our wealth of data, create predictions, and advanced AI for custom Large Language Models (LLM)!

We take care of office buildings worldwide! These offices are increasingly equipped with technology, such as sensors and Internet of Things (IoT) devices, to support a more productive and seamless workday for employees. The purpose of our Porto innovation lab is to develop differentiating, high-quality, and scalable digital solutions for both the ISS enterprise and customers worldwide.

We implement devices all over the place to make the buildings we serve digital and friendly.

Be part of a project to make the world work better!

Are you passionate about making a difference? We’re looking for a Sustainability BI Analyst to join our Global Business Intelligence & Competency Center (BICC) Team in Porto. In this role, you’ll serve as a vital link between our BI capabilities and business objectives, driving tangible value across the organization.

As a key player in fostering a strong data culture, you’ll collaborate with teams in various countries and global key accounts to propel ISS's progress toward our sustainability targets. Your contributions will be essential in delivering accurate reports for corporate reporting, customers, and global benchmarks, ultimately shaping the future of ISS through data.

If you’re ready to make an impact, we want to hear from you!

What will you do:


BI Expertise: Possesses comprehensive knowledge of reporting and BI frameworks, including data modeling when applicable. Responsible for translating business requirements into technical solutions and functional specifications. Plans, designs, develops, and delivers small-scale BI solutions within an established framework, collaborating closely with source system owners, business subject matter experts, and BI lead developers. In larger BI projects take responsibility for data analysis, functional requirement specification, data quality validation.
Insight Expertise: Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify and understand the key drivers of sustainability.
Integrator: Collaborates with the business to gather and translate new requirements into detailed functional specifications for application development. Engages in business process mapping and re-engineering in relation to BI needs, involving subject matter experts in data capture processes. Fosters a strong network to ensure a solid foundation of data and knowledge.
Enabler: Empowers teams to effectively utilize BI products while promoting knowledge sharing across segments to ensure scalability. Implements initiatives to enhance data literacy and prepare the organization for AI integration.
Project and Stakeholder Management: Responsible for prioritizing, planning, and delivering business solutions, including managing and mitigating risks associated with change.
Stakeholder Management: Cultivates strong relationships with relevant stakeholders, coordinating and prioritizing solution delivery. Effectively articulates solutions and breaks down problems by considering the perspectives of different stakeholders.



What makes you a great fit:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.
Minimum 3-5 years of proven experience in Business Intelligence reporting and data analysis, specifically with Power BI.
Knowledge of working with Microsoft Fabric is highly desirable.
Data Analysis: Proficiency in analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Database Management: Knowledge of database technologies such as SQL for querying and managing data.
BI Tools: Experience with BI tools like Tableau and Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Data Analysis: Ability to perform analysis to interpret data trends and patterns.
Dashboard Creation: Skills in creating interactive dashboards to present data insights effectively.
Programming: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.
Data Warehousing: Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Data Modeling : Competence in data modeling to structure data for analysis.
